title: Fiona Ross
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809023232/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Designers](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809023232/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Designers) : Fiona Ross**

Fiona Ross specializes in non-Latin [type design](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809023232/http:/typophile.com/wiki/type%20design) and [typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809023232/http:/typophile.com/wiki/typography). From 1978 to 1989 she worked for [Linotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809023232/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Linotype) Limited (UK) and was responsible for the design of Linotype’s non-Latin fonts and typesetting schemes. Since 1989 she has worked as a consultant, type designer and visiting lecturer, and in 2003 joined the [Department of Typography & Graphic Communication](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809023232/http:/www.rdg.ac.uk/Typography/home.html) at the [University of Reading](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809023232/http:/typophile.com/wiki/University%20of%20Reading), teaching non-Latin typeface design on the [MA in Typeface Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809023232/http:/typophile.com/wiki/MA%20in%20Typeface%20Design) programme, and academic writing skills for all postgraduates in the Department.  
Fiona Ross holds a BA in German, a PgDip in Sanskrit and Pali, and a PhD in Indian Palaeography from [SOAS](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809023232/http:/www.soas.ac.uk/) (School of Oriental and African Studies: University of London). She is a member of the [ATypI](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809023232/http:/typophile.com/wiki/ATypI) (Association Typographique International) and a Fellow of the Royal Society of Arts.
